thread.title: The nightmare scenario for the rest of the Pac-12 would be Chip Kelly becoming USC's coach: Issues & Answers
thread.title_full: The nightmare scenario for the rest of the Pac-12 would be Chip Kelly becoming USC's coach: Issues & Answers | OregonLive.com

author: Ken Goe | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: The nightmare scenario for the rest of the Pac-12 would be Chip Kelly becoming USC's coach: Issues & Answers
text:
On the surface, reports of a potential move by former Oregon coach Chip Kelly from the Philadelphia Eagles to USC make a lot of sense.
Kelly, a brilliantly innovative strategist, turned Oregon from a good Pac-12 program into a national power.
It's been tougher for him at the next level, where professional players are resistant to Kelly's hands-on attempts to reinvent the game.
This CBSSports.com piece Quote: s former NFL coach Brian Billick as saying that Eagles' player discontent has become a powder keg that is ready to blow.
This piece from ESPN.com's Phil Sheridan suggests Kelly's vision has run into a brick wall at that level.
I covered Kelly for two seasons at Oregon, and I suspect he is as sick of the pro players as they are of him.
If he is looking for somewhere to land, well, there are worse places than USC. I'm guessing the school would give him a monster paycheck and carte blanche.
Between the Trojans' football tradition and the school's location in the middle of one of college football's most fertile recruiting areas, USC has everything Kelly could need if he wants to return to the college level for an even more successful run.
Of course, the USC job isn't open. But last night's 17-12 loss to Washington led to Trojans coach Steve Sarkisian being booed off the field.
Dan Wolken of USA Today wrote that it is time for USC to pull the plug on Sarkisian and hire Kelly.
Sarkisian coached at Washington before bailing for the USC job. Former Boise State coach Chris Petersen succeeded him in Seattle, and a lot of people think the Huskies wound up with the better head coach.
Take a gander at these opinion pieces written in the wake of last night's game:
Matt Calkins of the Seattle Times: Washington's coaching upgrade was on full display in the Los Angeles Coliseum.
Chris Dufresne of the Los Angeles Times: The Trojans looked shoddy, sloppy and unprepared while losing to Washington.
Jeff Miller of the Orange County Register: Sarkisian was outcoached and USC was outplayed.
Stewart Mandel of FoxSports.com: For USC to be great, Sarkisian needs to go.
Pete Thamel of SI.com: Sarkisian was the wrong choice for USC.
Scott Wolf of the Los Angeles Daily News: Losses to double-digit underdogs are coming to define the Sarkisian era at USC.
I would keep an eye on developments.
And I know this: Kelly becoming USC's coach is a nightmare scenario for the rest of the Pac-12.
